definitions.definition: The act or time of shutting; close.
A door or cover; a shutter.
The line or place where two pieces of metal are welded together.
To close, to stop from being open.
To close, to stop being open.
definitions.example: If you wait too long, the automatic door will shut.

definitions.definition: To close a business temporarily, or (of a business) to be closed.
definitions.example: The pharmacy is shut on Sunday.

definitions.definition: To confine in an enclosed area.
definitions.example: I shut the cat in the kitchen before going out.

definitions.definition: To catch or snag in the act of shutting something.
definitions.example: He's just shut his finger in the door.

definitions.definition: To preclude; to exclude; to bar out.
A narrow alley or passage acting as a short cut through the buildings between two streets.
